review: This is my fourth one. I consider it the minimum TV access for all of my systems. I do have some Sony BD systems and three Internet capable TVs, but none of them can compare to the capabilities of the Amazon Fire TV module!

review: I already had a Roku 3 when I purchased my Amazon Fire TV.  I thought I had the fastest streamer available.  The Fire arrivedand opened my eyes to a new level in streaming speed.  Along with the speed, the Fire TV has a really sharp picture and great sound. The voice search on the remote has not failed me yet and is very accurate.

review: I will end up buying a second or third one. A couple of times it has given me some trouble on the network, but often it was the fault of my router. The only thing I really can't stand is Amazon's insistence on forcing you to put your photos on the main menu. Also there needs to be an easier way to access third-party apps. Its bandwidth is very limited for buffering HD video, but given the circumstances (I am using this to run Kodi), I really can't complain. As long as Amazon doesn't mess with the hardware and continues to allow me to sideload my apps, I'm as happy as a clam and will continue to buy more. I love the fact that I can plug in a USB hub and connect my gamepad, mouse and keyboard.
